Adding a sending stone that already had a pair severs the connection to that sending stone and links it to the new stones.
Traditional methods of destroying sending stones destroy added stones, but so do dispel magic spells and similar spells cast at 6th level or higher.

spell.name: Permanency

m.text: sapphire, emerald, ruby and diamond powder each worth 1000 gold per spell level, to include special inks worth 1000 gold, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell makes certain other spells permanent. You can cast the permanency spell and then follow it with the desired spell. Spells cast on other creatures, objects or locations (not on you) are vulnerable to dispel magic as normal. When you are targeted by dispel magic or an antimagic field, your permanency spells are suppressed until you complete a long rest. Depending on the spell, you must be of a minimum caster level and must expend the necessary components as mentioned above.

You can make spells permanent on yourself. The total level of spells that are made permanent cannot exceed your spellcasting ability modifier. Spells that can be made permanent on you must have a range of Self or Touch and have a casting time of a reaction, action, or bonus action. Spells with a range of self must target you and not require an object that is being worn or carried. You must be of a particular level to make spells of varying levels permanent on yourself, objects or areas. Only spells of 1st level can be made permanent on yourself, objects or areas and only spells on the wizard spell list are able to become permanent.
Spells with components that have a gold cost greater than 25 gp cannot be made permanent.
Spells that are made permanent on yourself or objects act as at will spells.

Much like magic items, a creature, item, or area can only have up to three permanent spells at one time. You can end a permanent spell on yourself or objects at any time. You can end a permanent spell that you created on an area while within 100 ft as an action.
Once a permanent spell is ended that spell also ends and is no longer permanent, and its benefits cannot be regained unless the spell and Permanency is cast again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th, the spells that can be made permanent are now 2nd level. When you use a spell slot of 9th level, the spells that can be made permanent are now 3rd level.

spell.name: Positive Energy Aura
entries: For the duration, if a creature within 30 feet of you regains hit points, they gain an additional hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. The regained hit points must have been the result of an instantaneous effect (such as a spell, potion, or regeneration; but not a long or short rest).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Power Word Recharge
entries: You speak the word and a magic item you touch regains {@dice 1d4} charges, up to its maximum number of charges.

spell.name: Protection from Spells

m.text: a diamond worth at least 500 gp, crushed and sprinkled on each target

entries: Target a number of creatures up to your casting ability modifier. The targets must all be within 5 feet of you at the time of casting. For the duration, the target or targets have advantage on saving throws against magic and magical effects.

spell.name: Quench
entries: The spell extinguishes all non-magical fires in a 30ft cube centered on a point within range. The spell can dispel magical fires or spells that do fire damage. To do so, make a spellcasting ability check (DC equals 10 + the spell slot used to cast the spell). On success, the fires within the area are dispelled.
If there is a Fire Elemental or a creature made of mostly or wholly with the fire, the target takes {@damage 8d6} cold damage.

Alternatively, you can satiate the thirst of up to 50 Medium or smaller creatures. To do so for Large or larger creatures, they count as two creatures for every size above Medium. Creatures that are satiated this way do not require water for 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher, increase the cube's area by 10ft and the damage dealt by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 3rd. Additionally, when casting this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase the amount of creatures by 10 for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Repulsion

m.text: A pair of small iron bars attached to two small canine statuettes, one black and one white, the whole array worth 50 gp

entries: An invisible, mobile field surrounds you and prevents creatures from approaching within 30ft radius of you. Any creature within or entering the field must attempt a Wisdom save. On a failed save, it becomes unable to move toward you as long as the spell remains in effect. On a successful save, they are unaffected. Repelled creatures' actions are not otherwise restricted.

They can fight other creatures and can cast spells and attack you with ranged weapons. If you move closer to an affected creature, nothing happens. (The creature is not forced back.) The creature is free to make melee attacks against you if you come within reach. If a repelled creature moves away from you and then tries to turn back toward you, it cannot move any closer if it is still within the spell's area.
Creatures that are repelled for the first time by this spell are under the spell effect until the effect is removed by {@spell Greater Restoration} or similar magic of 5th level or higher.

spell.name: Riddle
entries: You call upon an extraplanar entity, an alien intellect, or devious fiend, becoming a conduit for its power as you speak out a complex riddle. Creatures that cannot hear you or do not have a spoken language are unaffected with the exception of telepathy; however a creature understands the riddle even if it cannot understand your language, so long as it has at least one spoken language. Until a creature answers the riddle correctly by succeeding on an Intelligence save, it is subject to the crushing otherworldly presence of the being whose power you have called upon. On a successful save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition stunned} for the duration. At the start of each of the creature's turns before the spell ends, the creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage, and can make another saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Rusting Grasp
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature or non-magical object no greater than 5 feet in any dimension.
If the target was an object, on a hit all metal components of that object are instantly destroyed.

If the target was a creature, on a hit choose either a non-magical metal shield or weapon it is wielding, or metal armor it is wearing. That item takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed when it has an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. Metal weapons in use by an opponent targeted by this spell are more difficult to grasp. If you hit the weapon with this attack the metal weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Use the AC of the creature wielding the weapon to determine the AC of the weapon. Using this spell to damage weapons provokes an opportunity attack.

spell.name: Slashing Darkness
entries: You launch a hissing ribbon of pure darkness from your hand. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d8} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you increase the damage it deals by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spike Stones
entries: Spike stones impede progress through an area and deal damage. Any creature moving on foot into or through the spell's 20ft square area is moving through difficult terrain. In addition, each creature moving through the area takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage for every 5 feet of movement through the spiked area.

Any creature that takes damage from this spell must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell DC to avoid injuries to their feet and legs. A failed save causes the creature's speed half their normal speed for 24 hours or until the injured creature receives magical healing. Alternatively, affected creatures can remove the penalty by taking 10 minutes to dress the injuries and succeeding on a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) skill check against your spell DC. Spike stones is a magical trap that must be perceived by a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) skill check against your spell DC to notice it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, increase the duration by 1 hour per spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Stone Tell
entries: You gain the ability to speak with stones, which relate to you who or what has touched them as well as revealing what is covered or concealed behind or under them. The stones relate complete descriptions if asked. A stone's perspective, perception, and knowledge may prevent the stone from providing the details you are looking for. The stone can only provide knowledge within a 30 ft radius.
You can speak with natural or worked stone.

spell.name: Thirsting Blade
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon within this spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects as well as {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. You regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage inflicted by this spell. You do not regain hit points if the target is a construct or an undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thunder Shout
entries: A blast of echoing sound erupts out of your throat as a thunderous force bursts out in a 60-foot cone. Creatures within that cone must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 12d8} thunder damage and are pushed back 10 feet. In addition, if the creature fails the save by 5 or more, they are {@condition deafened}. If the creature fails, the save by 10 or more they are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition deafened}. On a successful save, affected creatures take half damage and are only pushed back 5 feet.

spell.name: Thunderwhip
entries: You evoke a vibrating whip in your free hand that is most disturbing to animals. The whip lasts for the duration. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the thunderwhip, which has a reach of 10 feet. On a hit it deals {@damage 2d4} thunder damage. If the target is a beast, you have advantage on attacks made with this spell and it becomes {@condition frightened} on hit until the end of its next turn. A beast that is immune to being {@condition frightened} instead takes an additional {@damage 2d4} thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the reach of the weapon increases by 5 feet and the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Transcription

components.m: a writing implement, a bottle of ink, a blank piece of paper or some other medium

entries: You instantly and flawlessly copy up to an entire page of non-magical text and/or images to another page or receptive medium. During the transcription process, you can decide to have the contents translated into a language of your choice. You must be fluent in the language in order to do this.

entries.name: Alternative Usage
entries: This spell can transcribe magical text or images, such as written spells, to another medium. However, casting the spell this way incurs an additional material cost: 25 gold pieces worth of rare inks is consumed per the spell level of the copied spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The amount of pages of content able to be transcribed increases exponentially for each spell slot above 1st. For each spell slot above 1st, double the amount of pages or spell levels copied using this spell to a maximum of 256.

spell.name: Tree Shape
entries: For the duration, you assume the form of a Large living tree or shrub or a Large dead tree trunk with a small number of limbs. All clothing and gear carried or worn changes with you. The closest inspection cannot reveal that the tree in question is a magically concealed creature. To all normal tests you are, in fact, a tree or shrub, although a detect magic spell reveals transmutation on the tree. While in tree form, you can observe all that transpires around you just as if you were in your normal form, and your hit points and save bonuses remain unaffected. You have an AC of 20, but gain no benefit from shields or other effects that increase AC. You automatically fail all Dexterity checks and saving throws, and you have a speed of 0 feet.
When you cease concentration on this spell, you instantly return to your normal form.

spell.name: Withering Destruction

m.text: a withered flower, a piece of obsidian worth at least , and an amethyst worth at least 100 gp

entries: You conjure a bolt of dark energy that leaps at a creature or object within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 9d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 by this spell dies, becoming a withered husk.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, increase the damage by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Withering Ray
entries: You create three rays of necromantic energy and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. If this damage reduces an organic target to 0 hit points, it dies instantly and withers into a husk. Inorganic targets such as constructs are not affected by this spell..
This spell automatically causes up to a 10-foot cube of non-magical plants, excluding plant creatures, to wither on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wood Shape
entries: Reshape one existing piece of inanimate wood within range into any shape that suits your purpose. The wood's initial and final forms must be within the space of a 10-foot cube. While it is possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth, fine detail isn't possible. It is possible to transmute a simple wooden weapon like a {@item club}, {@item greatclub}, or {@item quarterstaff} using this spell, but most other weapons or armors are too complex to create.

spell.name: Agonizing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon sends waves of excruciating pain through the creature's body, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone} and takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage at the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Arcane Sight
entries: This spell makes your eyes glow blue and allows you to see magical auras within 120 feet of you. These magical auras surround magic items and other sources or conduits of magic such as other spellcasters.

You know the location and power of all magical auras within your range of this spell. An aura's power depends on a spell's level or the effect that the magic item produces (the rarer the item, the stronger the aura produced). If the item(s) or creature(s) bearing the auras are within 120 feet of you, you know the school of magic involved in each object and the maximum spell slot level the item or creature can produce.

If you focus on an object, you can determine what that object can do as per the {@spell Identify} spell. If you focus on a creature, you can determine if that creature has a spellcasting feature such as a lich or other magical abilities such as a {@creature quasit}'s ability to turn {@condition invisible}. To do so, you must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) skill check with a DC of 10 + the following depending on the objects rarity: +2 for a common item, +4 for an uncommon item, +6 for a rare item, +8 for a very rare item, +10 for a legendary item and +15 for artifacts. For a creature, the DC is equal to 10 + the creature's highest level spell slot or the creature's CR; whichever is higher. Any creature with a CR of less than 1 is treated as having a CR of 0 when determining the DC of the {@skill Arcana} skill check.

spell.name: Armor of Flesh
entries: {@i Sticks and stones may break my bones but pain will never phase me.}

As an action, you touch one undead creature that is at least one size category larger and take control of its motor functions. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw against your spell DC. On failure, you take control of the target and use the targets Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, HP, Natural Armor, Features and {@action Attack} actions. However you keep your own Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, Feats and Class Features. On failure, the target makes an opportunity attack against you and is immune to this spell for 24 hours. You cannot target an undead creature with Legendary actions or a creature of CR 10 or higher with this spell.

If the target dies, the spell ends except that for the rest of the duration you can choose to stay within the corpse. When the spell's duration ends or it is dismissed with a bonus action, you are pushed out of the target. You then land within 5ft of the target {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Aura of Invisibility
entries: Magic wraps around you and your surrounding allies, hiding them from the view of others. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each creature of your choice within range becomes {@condition invisible} as described by the Invisibility spell.

spell.name: Blood Boiling
entries: Boil the blood in the veins of a creature you can see in range. The target takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. For the duration, at the beginning of each of its turns the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target.
This spell has no effect on creatures without blood or blood flow such as constructs, oozes, or undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage that occurs after a failed save increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Animate Plants
entries: You imbue inanimate plants with mobility and a semblance of life. You target up to two Huge, four Large or eight Medium or smaller plants. Each animated plant then immediately attacks whomever or whatever you initially designate as though it were an animated object similar to the {@spell animate objects} spell of the appropriate size category. You can command the plants to move or attack with a bonus action. While in combat, the plants act on your initiative.

Alternatively, you may imbue all plants within range with a degree of mobility, which allows them to entwine around creatures in the area. This usage of the spell duplicates the effect of an {@spell entangle} spell. This effect lasts the duration, until dispelled or until dismissed with a bonus action.
Animate plants cannot affect plant creatures, nor does it affect non-living vegetable material.

spell.name: Blood Rain

m.text: a vial of blood from any sapient creature, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose a 30-foot radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder within range. A red, bloodlike fluid rains down in this cylinder. Creatures other than you which begin their turn in the target area or enter it on their turn must succeed on a Constitution save or take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage. This spell has a reversed effect on undead, causing them to instead regain {@dice 2d8} hit points.
While concentrating on this spell, you can use your action to move the pillar up to 20 feet in any direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage and healing both increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bonesword

m.text: one bone at least 6 inches long, which the spell consumes

entries: A bone, held in your free hand, becomes a shortsword, longsword, or greatsword. It lasts for the duration and then crumbles to dust. Anyone may use the bonesword, and it is a magic weapon. On a hit it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage against living creatures, and an extra {@damage 1d6} damage against good-aligned creatures. The extra damage is of the same type as the weapon's base damage (piercing or slashing).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the extra damage inflicted on living or good-aligned creatures increases by {@dice 1d6} for each two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Bound Weapon
entries: A weapon you have previously bound to you returns to you from almost any distance. Bound weapon can be cast in one of two different ways.

entries.name: Bind
entries: As an action, you touch a weapon in your possession and bind it to yourself indefinitely. If the weapon is already bound to you, you may instead unbind it. You may only have one weapon bound at any given time. A bound weapon may not be bound anyone other than you unless you die, you remove this binding, or the weapon is damaged beyond use.

entries.name: Call
entries: As a bonus action, you call a bound weapon you have to one of your free hands, at your feet, or in any unoccupied space within 5 feet. If there is too little room to hold the weapon, the spell fails. A bound weapon can be called from up to 200 miles away as long as it is on the same plane as you.

spell.name: Call of Crusaders
entries: Until the spell ends, your deity sends down the souls of paladins to aid you in battle. You summon a number of paladins equal to your Charisma modifier (min 1) within a radius of 30 feet of you. Equipment that the paladins are summoned with cannot be worn by another creature. If attempted, the equipment becomes spectral energy and goes back onto the paladin it was taken from. The paladins are under your control and will follow the commands of those you choose.

spell.name: Create Air
entries: Creates fresh air around yourself and up to 2 other creatures.
When this spell is cast it creates a bubble of clean air around the target. This drives out foul or stale air and turns it to fresh air.

If the target is affected by a spell that creates a gas or gas-like substance such as the {@spell cloudkill} spell it will allow the target to ignore the effect of the spell until the start of their next turn. before the effect of spell/event is in effect again

Choose up to 3 creatures at a point within range. The creatures must be within 10 feet of each other. The creatures targeted recieve fresh, clean, breathable air. If one or more targets is affected by a gas, or gas like effect, such as cloudkill, the target can ignore the effects until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, 1 additional creature can be targeted per level of the spell slot above 1st level.

spell.name: Darkbolt
entries: You unleash seven bolts of darkness from your open palms and fire them at targets within range. You can fire them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Choose one of the following two options when you cast this spell:

items: You fire all the bolts at once as part of casting the spell and all targets must be within 60 feet of each other. When you use this option, the spell's duration is instantaneous.

You cast this spell -and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter- you can expend up to two of the bolts to fire them at a target or targets you choose within range. When you use this option, the spell's duration is Concentration, up to 10 minutes.

entries: No matter how many bolts strike a single target, a target can only be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create one additional bolt for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Deep Pockets

components.m: a tiny golden needle and a strip of fine cloth

entries: You touch a non-magical set of clothes and fashion it with numerous hand-sized pockets with extra-dimensional interiors. For the duration of the spell, items placed in the pockets are considered to weigh one tenth of their weight for the purpose of carrying capacity. The pockets combined can hold up to 200 lbs. When the spell ends, the contents of the pockets fall to the floor.

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: A green ray springs from your outstretched hand at a creature or object you can see within range. You must make a ranged spell attack to hit the target. This ray automatically hits objects that are not being worn or carried. On a hit, the target is unable to be affected by teleportation spells (such as {@spell dimension door} and {@spell teleport}), plane shifting, astral travel and ethereal travel.

A dimensional anchor does not interfere with the movement of creatures already in ethereal or astral form when the spell is cast, nor does it block the ability to see into other planes of existence or affect them. Also, dimensional anchor does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of a summoning spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, change the duration to 10 minutes. When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, change the duration to 1 hour. When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot, change the duration to 4 hours. When you cast this spell using an 8th level spell slot, change the duration to 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, change the duration to 24 hours.

spell.name: Disarm

components.m: a bit of foam or butter

entries: You disarm an enemy creature of a weapon or other object it's holding. Choose a weapon or other object in range that weighs up to 15 pounds and is being held by a creature. The creature holding the object must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the object flies out of its grasp towards you. If it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free, you can catch it; otherwise, it lands at your feet. The creature has advantage on this save if it is holding the object in both hands.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional object for each slot level above 2nd. The objects must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them

spell.name: Discern Lies
entries: Each round, you concentrate on one subject, who must be within range. You know if the subject deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. Creatures that are targeted make a Charisma saving throw. The spell does not reveal the truth, uncover unintentional inaccuracies, or necessarily reveal evasions. While under the effect of this spell, you have advantage on {@skill Insight} skill checks made against targets who fail the saving throw.
As a bonus action at the start of your turn, you may concentrate on a different subject.

spell.name: Disrupting Weapon
entries: Touch a melee weapon. Any undead creature hit with this weapon thereafter with hit points of 200 hit points or less must succeed a Wisdom saving throw at disadvantage or be destroyed. Undead creatures with legendary actions are not destroyed by this spell, instead they take an additional {@damage 8d6} radiant damage or half as much on a successful save.

spell.name: Divine Power
entries: While you are under the effects of this spell, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you may make one additional weapon attack, and weapon attacks that you make count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage.

spell.name: Endure Elements
entries: {@i Protection from normal environmental hazards.}

You can target up to 6 willing creatures. A creature protected by endure elements suffers no harm from being in a hot or cold environment. It automatically succeeds on all saving throws made to resist the effects of {@hazard Extreme Cold} and {@hazard Extreme Heat} weather conditions, as per the weather conditions in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. The creature's equipment is likewise protected. This spell doesn't provide any protection from fire or cold damage, nor does it protect against other environmental hazards such as smoke, lack of air, and so forth

spell.name: Energized Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon sends electrifying energy through the target's body, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} lightning damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Energetic Ensemble

components.m: an instrument you are proficient with

entries: For the duration of this spell and while within range, you and up to your Charisma modifier number of creatures are under the effect of the haste spell. When this spell ends, you and other creatures affected by this spell, gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. If a creature leaves the radius of this spell, the effect ends immediately and they cannot take an action until the start of their next turn. If you are hit and take damage, If you are hit and take damage, make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you take 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. The DC for this save is equal to 10 plus the number of creatures affected by this spell or half the damage, whichever is higher.

spell.name: Erase
entries: Remove writings of either magical or mundane nature from one scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces.

With this spell, you can also remove spells similar to {@spell Glyph of Warding}, {@spell Illusory Script} or a {@spell Symbol} spell from surfaces . Non-magical writing is automatically erased if you touch it and no one else is holding it. Otherwise, the chance of erasing non-magical writing must be determined by rolling percentile dice ({@dice 1d100}). On a roll of 90 or less, the spell succeeds in erasing the non-magical writing despite someone holding the source of the writing.

To erase magical writing, you must touch the writing and succeed on a spellcasting ability check. Touching the runes as part of casting this spell does not trigger them. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the script or spell is erased. If you fail to erase glyphs of warding, arcane runes or the like, you accidentally activate it instead.

spell.name: Explosive Arrows
entries: You touch a quiver containing arrows or bolts. When a target is hit by a ranged weapon attack using a piece of ammunition drawn from the quiver, the target takes an extra {@damage 6d6} fire damage. In addition, each creature (excluding the initial target) within a 20ft radius of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, targets take {@damage 3d6} fire damage or half as much on a successful save. The spell's magic ends on the piece of ammunition when it hits or misses, and the spell ends when eight pieces of ammunition have been drawn from the quiver.

spell.name: Fade

time.condition: which you take when you are damaged

entries: Immediately after taking damage, you fade from view and become harder to hit and locate. You and everything you are wearing or carrying becomes {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn. The spell ends early if you make an attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you remain {@condition invisible} for the duration even if you attack, deal damage, or force a saving throw.

spell.name: Fire Seeds

components.m: up to 4 nuts or up to 8 berries

entries: Depending on the material component used for this spell, you can create the following: Nut Grenades or Berry Bombs.

entries.name: Nut Grenades
entries: As many as four nuts turn into ranged weapons that can be thrown up to 100ft away. To use these objects, it requires you to make a ranged spell attack to hit the target. Each acorn does {@damage 4d6} fire damage. Each nut explodes upon impacting any hard surface. Any combustible materials within 10ft of the target ignites. A targeted creature can make a Dexterity saving throw. On success, targets take half damage.

entries.name: Berry Bombs
entries: You turn as many as eight berries into special bombs. Berry Bombs have to be placed by hand as attempting to throw it will cause it to detonate on the creature that threw it. If you are within 200ft and speak the command word, each berry bomb instantly bursts into flame, causing creatures within a 5 ft radius to make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} fire damage and igniting any combustible materials within 5 ft. On success, targets take half damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or higher, increase the number of nut grenades by 2 or the number of berry bombs by 4.

spell.name: Firebeads
entries: A series of fiery beads spring from your hand, darting across the battlefield. Choose up to six different points within range. Each of those points is struck by a bead, creatures within a 10 ft radius of those points must make a Dexterity saving throw taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Area of effect for multiple beads can overlap, but the damage does not stack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, add 1 bead to the volley for each slot level above 3rd.

An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attuned to it. To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period.

As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

The armor is padded with thick batting made from special absorbent fibers. This tends to wipe clean any sharp objects that penetrate it. The wearer of this armor has resistance to poison damage from poison-coated weapons, but not from the fangs of creatures that inject their venom as they bite.

These short, sharp spikes can be added to any suit of armor. When you use the attack action to grapple a creature, the target takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage if your grapple check succeeds. Armor so modified is "spiked armor" for purposes of the Battlerager Armor class feature but this damage is not additive with that feature.
This suit of armor is cunningly designed to be much easier to put on or remove. Halve the normal time necessary to don or doff such armor.

This armor's design mostly encloses the body with protective materials that are impervious to liquid. The wearer has resistance to damage from any liquid splashed on her, including contact poisons, defoliant, holy water, and the like. Caustic substances like acid and alchemist's fire are not affected because their damage does not rely on absorption through the skin or a mystical reaction caused by contact with the flesh.

If the wearer of this armor suffers a critical hit, and it was not delivered by a weapon with the ersatz weapon property, the armor sustains significant damage. For every such hit, the armor suffers a permanent and cumulative–1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to a protective rating of 10 is destroyed. A crafter using the applicable artisan's tools can repair this armor if it has not yet been destroyed. Each–1 penalty applied is repaired at a cost of 5% of the armor's charted value.If the wearer of this armor suffers a critical hit, and it was not delivered by a weapon with the ersatz weapon property, the armor sustains significant damage. For every such hit, the armor suffers a permanent and cumulative–1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to a protective rating of 10 is destroyed. A crafter using the applicable artisan's tools can repair this armor if it has not yet been destroyed. Each–1 penalty applied is repaired at a cost of 5% of the armor's charted value.

This heavy helmet is more protective than the head covering that normally comes with a suit of armor. It fully encases the head and neck, while a visor fully protects the face. Great helms often bear decorative plumes, crests, or elaborate figurines on top. Wearing a great helm provides a +1 bonus to saving throws against area spells and effects, like a dragon's breath weapon or a fireball spell. It also grants immunity to the special mechanics of saps and garrotes. Wearing a great helm imposes disadvantage on the wearer's Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

The plating of this armor is particularly resistant to forceful penetration; the wearer's Armor Class is not penalized for attacks made with the breach weapon property. To be fully protected, a shield-bearing character must have this property on both her armor and her shield, since the breach property can apply to either.

Rather than relying upon a single layer of protective material, this armor uses multiple protective layers cleverly constructed to divert and trap missiles (or their fragments) that would otherwise stick in the wearer's body. Attacks with Cruel weapons do not stick in the armor wearer or leave behind pieces that must be removed. A harpoon requires at least 10 points of damage for it to bind and restrain the armor wearer.

This armor is constructed with expensive, lighter materials. When made lightweight, a suit of light or medium armor reduces its weight by 4 pounds and removes the disadvantage modifier to Dexterity (Stealth) checks, if any. A suit of lightweight heavy armor reduces its weight by 10 pounds and removes the Strength requirement. A lightweight shield halves its weight and removes the Strength requirement, if any.

This suit of armor, or its bulkiest portions, can be removed with a single action. This is advantageous when the armor might inhibit the wearer's swimming or it has been affected by a {@spell heat metal} spell. Donning the suit is no faster than normal.
This armor redoubles its protection over certain vulnerable spots. Weapon attacks made against the wearer do not benefit from the deadly or high-critical weapon properties.
A reinforced gorget is a metal collar that protects the wearer's neck and clavicle region. This protective device grants immunity to the special mechanics of garrotes.

This heat-resistant plate and set of brackets mounts on the front of a shield. This device can attach to any kind of shield except a buckler. It is built to lock in a lit torch or sunrod, allowing the shield-bearer to carry a light source in the same hand as the shield. A shield modified with a sconce cannot also bear an emblem holy symbol or {@item Shield Spikes|WorldofCollabris|shield spikes}.

These sharp studs cover the face of a shield, making it into a convincing weapon. They can be applied to a shield, but not a buckler, pavise, or tower shield. When the affected shield is used as an improvised weapon, it inflicts {@damage 1d4} piercing damage instead of bludgeoning damage. Additionally, when you use the Attack action to shove a creature, you can inflict the spikes' piercing damage if your check succeeds. (Do not add your ability modifier to damage when using the spikes in a shove).

A shield modified with spikes cannot also bear a {@item Shield Sconce|WorldofCollabris|sconce} or an emblem holy symbol. {@creature Lizardfolk|MM} are particularly skilled with spiked shields and can use them to exceptional effect.

Using various techniques, affected armor takes on the appearance of normal—though sometimes bulky—clothing. Leather padding can be sewn inside canvas tunics and baggy trousers. Chain can be disguised with quilting. Even narrow plates and splinting can be incorporated into the lining of heavy coats.

This modification can apply to most armors suits, excluding half plate and plate. Heavy or medium armor with this addition can be identified with a DC 20 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check by anyone within 30 feet. Physically handling any kind of subtle armor reveals its nature without a check. A suit of subtle armor costs twice its normal price.

magicvariant.name: Barding, Canine (Large)

entries: Barding is armor designed for mounts or other animals. It typically covers the head, neck, and body, leaving the legs free of impediment (and protection).
Canine barding typically fits all canines of the same size.
Barding is armor designed for mounts or other animals. It typically covers the head, neck, and body, leaving the legs free of impediment (and protection).

Any armor shown on the Armor table in chapter 2 can be purchased or crafted as barding. The cost and weight are shown as multiples of the equivalent armor when made for humanoids. For example, a "x2" cost doubles what the armor would normally cost.

Canine barding typically fits all canines of the same size, and equine barding typically fits all equines of the same size. But exotic barding is made for animals of a specific type as well as a specific size.
For example, despite being the same size, a Large dragon's exotic barding cannot be transferred to a giant seahorse.

Canine barding typically fits all canines of the same size.

Equine barding typically fits all equines of the same size.

items: You no longer have penalties for sleeping in armor.

If you are proficient in medium armor, wearing it no longer counts towards your carry capacity. If you are proficient in heavy armor, wearing it now counts for half of its weight towards your carry capacity.
You ignore the Strength requirement of armor.
You do not suffer the negative effects of traveling at a Forced March.

You learn {@filter two infusions|optionalfeatures|feature type=ai} of your choice from among those available to the {@class Artificer|TCE} class that do not have a level requirement or gold cost. If an infusion you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the infusion's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. If an infusion would improve at a certain level in Artificer, it does not improve for you unless you are an Artificer of that level.
You can use one of these infusions at a time. If you already have infusions, then you increase the amount of infusions you can use at a time by one.

You learn the {@spell Scorching Ray} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=V;C} of your choice. The 1st level spell must be from the evocation or conjuration school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

You learn the {@spell Lesser Restoration} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=A;T} of your choice. The 1st level spell must be from the abjuration or transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Light armor being worn no longer counts towards your carry capacity.

While wearing light armor, you can use your reaction to reduce damage dealt to you as the result of a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Dexterity modifier plus your proficiency bonus to a minimum of 1.
You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks to escape non-magical effects that {@condition grappled|PHB|grapple} or {@condition restrained|PHB|restrain}.
You can add your Dexterity modifier when determining your jump distance for your high and long jumps.
On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can move up to half your speed as a reaction.

Before you make a melee attack with a light weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to gain a bonus equal to your Dexterity modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you do not add your Dexterity modifier to the weapon's damage. In order to gains this benefit, you must add your Dexterity modifier to your weapon damage.
You are proficient in all {@filter firearms|items|type=firearm}.
You can conceal handguns with advantage on your Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check.
You have advantage on initiative checks when wielding a firearm.
You are proficient with all {@filter firearms|items|type=firearm} and with {@item tinker's tools|phb}
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with any firearm.
Double the number of ammunition pieces you can normally load into a single firearm with each action or bonus action, up to the weapon's capacity.

vehicle.name: Light Mechsuit

trait.name: Pilot
entries: The mechsuit requires a Dwarf or Gnome with {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} and appropriate Armor proficiency to pilot it. While inside the Mechsuit, the pilot uses the mechsuit's speed, replaces their Strength and Constitution scores (unless their score is higher) and has total cover.
{@note Rock Gnomes do not require armor proficiency to use mechsuits.}

trait.name: Modules
entries: The Light Core Mechsuit can hold a maximum of 5 {@filter modules|items|type=module}.

fluff: The Light core mechsuit is primarily used for civilian use and can be seen in daily life of Mechatopia. They can range in appearance, but they all provided the same basic functions. They can have a maximum of 5 modules applied to the core. Though they typically have ones designed to fulfill a simple purpose.

vehicle.name: Medium Mechsuit

trait.name: Pilot
entries: The mechsuit requires a Dwarf or Gnome with {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} and appropriate Armor proficiency to pilot it. While inside the Mechsuit, the pilot uses the mechsuit's speed, replaces their Strength and Constitution scores (unless their score is higher) and has total cover.
{@note Rock Gnomes do not require armor proficiency to use mechsuits.}

trait.name: Modules
entries: The Medium Core Mechsuit can hold a maximum of 10 {@filter modules|items|type=module}.

trait.name: Shutdown Prevention
entries: The Medium Core Mechsuit can ignore one effect that would deactivate a module once per long rest, taking the damage as normal.

fluff: The Medium core mechsuit is a bit more robust, though the doubling of cost and weight is expected to reflect that. It is slightly hardier than the Light Core but tends to have modules applied geared to complex professions. The Medium core mechsuit can ignore one effect that would deactivate a module once per long rest, taking the damage as normal. The Medium core mechsuit can have up to 10 modules applied.

vehicle.name: Heavy Mechsuit

trait.name: Pilot
entries: The mechsuit requires a Dwarf or Gnome with {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} and appropriate Armor proficiency to pilot it. While inside the Mechsuit, the pilot uses the mechsuit's speed, replaces their Strength and Constitution scores (unless their score is higher) and has total cover.
{@note Rock Gnomes do not require armor proficiency to use mechsuits.}

trait.name: Modules
entries: The Heavy Mechsuit Core can hold a maximum of 15 {@filter modules|items|type=module}.

trait.name: Shutdown Prevention
entries: The Heavy core mechsuit can ignore one effect that would deactivate a module twice per long rest, taking the damage as normal.

fluff: The Heavy core mechsuit is the military model. It is designed to take hit and last quite well in a battle The Heavy core mechsuit can ignore one effect that would deactivate a module twice per long rest, taking the damage as normal. The Heavy core mechsuit can have up to 15 modules applied.

entries.name: Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Feat
entries: You gain one {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice.

entries.name: Military Training
entries: Your training through the conscription into the Haldrim military has granted you two of the following proficiencies: {@skill Athletics}, Vehicles (land), Vehicles (water), (Vehicles (air), {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, or {@skill Intimidation}. In addition, donning and doffing armor you are proficient in takes ½ the time it normally would.

entries.name: Culture of War
entries: Being required to carry and be proficient with what is available has led to you gaining the following proficiencies: {@filter light armor|items|type=light armor}, {@filter medium armor|items|type=medium armor}, {@item longsword|PHB|longswords}, small arm and long arm firearms, and firearm repair kits.

entries.name: Scholar
entries: The dedication you made to knowledge yields you two skill proficiencies from the following list: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Nature}.

entries.name: Pursuit of Craft
entries: To be a great scholar, you must also be able to supplement it with a vocation. You have proficiency with one Artisan tool from the following list: {@item Jeweler's Tools|phb}, {@item Alchemist's Supplies|phb}, or {@item Herbalism Kit|phb}. You have advantage to skill checks when making a check with your Pursuit of Craft tool proficiency.

entries.name: Awakened Thoughts
entries: Through some manner unknown to the people of Cardus are now able to command varying mental abilities. You know the one of the following cantrips: {@spell Mage Hand}, {@spell Message}, or {@spell Mind Sliver|TCE}. You can cast this cantrip without spell components. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast one of the following spells: {@spell Charm Person}, {@spell Id Insinuation|UAFighterRogueWizard}, or {@spell Sense Emotion (UA)|UAStarterSpells|Sense Emotion} once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast one of the following spells: {@spell Detect Thoughts}, {@spell Mind Spike|XGE}, or {@spell Tasha's Mind Whip|TCE} once and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: Instead of tending to their aggressive nature, Urshok Orcs have been forced to become tough due to the Korborn under the rule of Lord Dharmock.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Wild Rider
entries: Orcs from the Ban Turr Step have tamed and mastered the wild horses of the area becoming quite efficient at controlling mounts and tracking.
You have advantage on checks made to control ridable mounts and are able to use your Strength for {@skill Animal Handling} checks. In addition, you have proficiency in {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Mechatopia Masterpiece
entries: You gain one skill proficiency, one {@filter tool|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools; tools} proficiency, and you double your proficiency with the chosen tool proficiency. You are able to integrate into your form up to one tool that you are proficient in, a one handed weapon that you are proficient in, and store up to 50 lbs of equipment separate from your carry/lift/drag.

entries.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one {@filter tool|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools; tools} proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

entries.name: Envoys: Specialized Design
entries: As the name implies, most warforged were built to fight in the Last War. The vast majority of warforged are juggernauts or skirmishers—soldiers and scouts who fought under the banner of one of the Five Nations. Warforged envoys, however, were designed to perform other functions. As an envoy, you have a skill, a tool proficiency, and a tool that's part of your body. When you make an envoy character, consider the following questions: What is your purpose? How does your skill and your tool reflect that purpose? What form does your integrated tool take? If you have embedded thieves' tools, for instance, are your fingers actually lockpicks, or can you produce keys from various parts of your body? The following characters are examples of warforged with integrated tools.
{@b Lute} is a bard with the entertainer background; his namesake instrument folds out of his left arm.
{@b Compass Rose} is a wizard with the outlander background. A keen explorer, she uses her built-in {@item cartographer's tools|phb} to record the paths she travels.

{@b Masque} is an infiltrator. A rogue with the charlatan background and an integrated {@item disguise Kit|phb}, she was built to blend in and assassinate. Cannith built six warforged of her design, and Masque has vowed to hunt down and destroy the other five.

In developing your integrated tool, remember that you must have your hands free to use it. Masque, the infiltrator mentioned above, doesn't shapeshift like a changeling; she has to manually adjust her appearance.

entries.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Iron Fists
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can deal {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. (See {@book chapter 8|PHB|8|Travel Pace} of the Player's Handbook for information about travel pace.)

entries.name: Voracious
entries: You are able to eat anything and be considered fed. Whether that be rotted meat, grubs, or just regular food. In addition, to ensure you keep hold of your food, you have advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks made to grapple.

entries.name: Brawn over Smarts
entries: You believe that strength can overcome any obstacle. When making saving throws against effects that cause the {@condition frightened} condition, you can use your Strength modifier for the saving throw instead of what is called for.

entries.name: Boulder Tough Skin
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 15. You cannot add your Dexterity modifier to your natural AC. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Giant Artisan
entries: You have proficiency in one {@filter Artisan tool|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

entries.name: Dreadnaught Training
entries: You are able to benefit from wielding two {@item shield|PHB|shields} at the same time. The AC bonus you get from wielding two shields is the average AC of both shields plus 1 to a maximum of your AC bonus equal to your proficiency bonus. {@item Shield|PHB|Shields} are now considered martial weapons you are proficient in. That deal [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage plus your Strength modifier on hit. Shields with the heavy property deal [[/r 1d8]] bludgeoning damage plus your Strength modifier on hit.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Trophy Hunter
entries: As part of a Short Rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, Dragon, or Monstrosity creature of size Small or larger to create one of the following items: a {@item Shield|PHB}, a {@item club|PHB}, a {@item Javelin|PHB}, a {@item Greataxe|PHB}, a {@item Net|PHB}, a weapon you are proficient in that doesn't have they heavy property with exception of the Greataxe, or armor you are proficient in that isn't heavy armor. To use this trait, you only need a blade, such as a {@item Dagger|PHB}, you require no proficiency or artisan tool to make these items.

entries.name: Appraise
entries: You are able to determine the value of any gemstone up to 1000 gold without fail.

entries.name: Cloud Casting
entries: You have innate spellcasting. You can cast the {@spell light|PHB} cantrip. At 3rd level, you can cast, {@spell feather fall|PHB} and at 5th level you can cast {@spell misty step|PHB}. You regain both spells after a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Storm Resistance
entries: You have resistance to either lightning or thunder damage.

entries.name: Lightning Toss
entries: You can cast the {@spell Chromatic Orb|PHB} spell dealing lighting damage, requiring no material components, and you can use this ability up to a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You recover the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Chilling Grasp
entries: You know the {@spell Ray of Frost} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Lingering Winter
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Fire Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item greatsword|phb}, and {@item maul|phb}.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Ingan.

entries.name: Desert Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item whips|phb}, {@item blowguns|phb}, {@item shortbows|phb}, and {@item longbows|phb}.

entries.name: Desert Adapation
entries: Due to being born and raised within the harsh deserts, you have acclimated to the heat. You're naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide and are not hindered by difficult terrain when in sandy environments.

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: Deserts are harsh and unforgiving, you must know how to survive. You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Mountain Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item warhammer|phb}, {@item maul|phb}, {@item heavy crossbow|phb}, and {@item battleaxe|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You are proficient in one {@filter artisan tool|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

entries.name: Mountain Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE|Earthen Grasp} spell once per day. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Terran.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Scaled Skin
entries: When unarmored, your Armor Class is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Dragon Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Gust|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Identify|PHB} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Dragon's Breath|XGE} spell on yourself once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Draconic.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Auran.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Drow Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}.

subrace.name: Eladrin
entries: {@i Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, any eladrin can change their season. See the "Info" tab for more information.}

entries.name: Fey Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Aquan.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Swim
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 30 ft.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subrace.name: Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item greatsword|phb}, and {@item maul|phb}.

entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Desert Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item whips|phb}, {@item blowguns|phb}, {@item shortbows|phb}, and {@item longbows|phb}.

entries.name: Desert Adapation
entries: Due to being born and raised within the harsh deserts, you have acclimated to the heat. You're naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide and are not hindered by difficult terrain when in sandy environments.

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: Deserts are harsh and unforgiving, you must know how to survive. You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Mountain Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item warhammer|phb}, {@item maul|phb}, {@item heavy crossbow|phb}, and {@item battleaxe|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You are proficient in one {@filter artisan tool|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

entries.name: Mountain Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE|Earthen Grasp} spell once per day. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Scaled Skin
entries: When unarmored, your Armor Class is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Dragon Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Gust|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Identify|PHB} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Dragon's Breath|XGE} spell on yourself once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding Frenzy. As a Bonus Action, you can make a Special Attack with your bite. If the Attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain Temporary Hit Points (minimum of 1) equal to your Constitution modifier, and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or Long Rest.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Large Jaw
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike. Instead of dealing damage, you can choose to make a Strength check with advantage and attempt to grapple a creature that is Medium or smaller.

entries.name: Thick Tail
entries: Your tail is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. It is much more profound and powerful than the common reptilian. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Adaptive Skin
entries: Your skin can shift in color depending on your temperament. You can shift your scale color between Black, Blue, Green, Red or White.

entries.name: Tough Scales
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
